meanings.definition: A person who makes a covenant or agreement.
meanings.sent1: The covenanter signed the agreement with a firm handshake.
meanings.sent2: The covenanters gathered to discuss the terms of their agreement.
meanings.sent3: The covenanter jokingly said, 'I covenant to always finish the last slice of pizza!'
meanings.sent4: She was known as the covenanter of the family, always keeping her promises.
meanings.sent5: The young covenanter vowed to always be honest and kind.

meanings.definition: A group of people who enter into a covenant or agreement.
meanings.sent1: The covenanters met regularly to ensure everyone upheld their promises.
meanings.sent2: The village covenanters gathered under the ancient oak tree to renew their vows.
meanings.sent3: The covenanters decided to make a pact to always share their snacks during lunch.
meanings.sent4: The team of covenanters worked together seamlessly, like a well-oiled machine.
meanings.sent5: The covenanters stood united, bound by their shared commitment to support each other.
